arachni_report.title: Web Application Security Report - Arachni Framework

issue.name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
issue.description: Client-side code (like JavaScript) can be injected into the web application which is then returned to the user's browser. This can lead to a compromise of the client's system or serve as a pivoting point for other attacks.
issue.remedy_guidance: User inputs must be validated and filtered before being returned as part of the HTML code of a page.

issue.name: Cross-Site Scripting in HTML tag.
issue.description: Unvalidated user input is being embedded in a HTML element. This can lead to a Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability or a form of HTML manipulation.
issue.remedy_guidance: User inputs must be validated and filtered before being returned as part of the HTML code of a page.

issue.name: Cross-Site Scripting in event tag of HTML element.
issue.description: Unvalidated user input is being embedded inside an HMTL event element such as "onmouseover". This makes Cross-Site Scripting attacks much easier to mount since the user input lands in code waiting to be executed.
issue.remedy_guidance: User inputs must be validated and filtered before being included in executable code or not be included at all.
issue.mod_name: XSS in HTML element event attribute

</script>

issue.name: Cross-Site Request Forgery
issue.description: The web application does not, or can not, sufficiently verify whether a well-formed, valid, consistent request was intentionally provided by the user who submitted the request. This is due to a lack of secure anti-CSRF tokens to verify the freshness of the submitted data.
issue.remedy_guidance: A unique token that guaranties freshness of submitted data must be added to all web application elements that can affect business logic.

issue.name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
issue.description: Client-side code (like JavaScript) can be injected into the web application which is then returned to the user's browser. This can lead to a compromise of the client's system or serve as a pivoting point for other attacks.
issue.remedy_guidance: User inputs must be validated and filtered before being returned as part of the HTML code of a page.

issue.name: Cross-Site Scripting in HTML "script" tag.
issue.description: Unvalidated user input is being embedded inside a <script> element. This makes Cross-Site Scripting attacks much easier to mount since user input lands inside a trusted script.
issue.remedy_guidance: User inputs must be validated and filtered before being included in executable code or not be included at all.

<script language="VBScript"> Dim orderId Rem orderId = arachni_user"arachni_xss_in_script_tag_1ac2d6585c5aeb053b8284400c569db88cc7c3496eda4f0e1d8f19ed71f85efa" Document.Write ("Order Approved") </script>

<script language="VBScript"> Dim orderId Rem orderId = arachni_user'arachni_xss_in_script_tag_1ac2d6585c5aeb053b8284400c569db88cc7c3496eda4f0e1d8f19ed71f85efa' Document.Write ("Order Approved") </script>

issue.name: Cross-Site Scripting in event tag of HTML element.
issue.description: Unvalidated user input is being embedded inside an HMTL event element such as "onmouseover". This makes Cross-Site Scripting attacks much easier to mount since the user input lands in code waiting to be executed.
issue.remedy_guidance: User inputs must be validated and filtered before being included in executable code or not be included at all.

issue.name: Cross-Site Request Forgery
issue.description: The web application does not, or can not, sufficiently verify whether a well-formed, valid, consistent request was intentionally provided by the user who submitted the request. This is due to a lack of secure anti-CSRF tokens to verify the freshness of the submitted data.
issue.remedy_guidance: A unique token that guaranties freshness of submitted data must be added to all web application elements that can affect business logic.

issue.name: Blind SQL Injection (timing attack)
issue.description: SQL code can be injected into the web application even though it may not be obvious due to suppression of error messages. (This issue was discovered using a timing attack; timing attacks can result in false positives in cases where the server takes an abnormally long time to respond. Either case, these issues will require further investigation even if they are false positives.)
issue.remedy_guidance: Suppression of error messages leads to security through obscurity which is not a good practise. The web application needs to enforce stronger validation on user inputs.

issue.name: Code injection (timing attack)
issue.description: Arbitrary code can be injected into the web application which is then executed as part of the system. (This issue was discovered using a timing attack; timing attacks can result in false positives in cases where the server takes an abnormally long time to respond. Either case, these issues will require further investigation even if they are false positives.)
issue.remedy_guidance: User inputs must be validated and filtered before being evaluated as executable code. Better yet, the web application should stop evaluating user inputs as any part of dynamic code altogether.

issue.remedy_guidance: Suppression of error messages leads to security through obscurity which is not a good practise. The web application needs to enforce stronger validation on user inputs.

issue.remedy_guidance: Suppression of error messages leads to security through obscurity which is not a good practise. The web application needs to enforce stronger validation on user inputs.

profiler.description:
Examines the behavior of the web application gathering general statistics and performs taint analysis to determine which inputs affect the output.
It does not perform any vulnerability assesment nor does it send attack payloads.

uniformity.description: Analyzes the scan results and logs issues which persist across different pages. This is usually a sign for a lack of a central/single point of input sanitization, a bad coding practise.

healthmap.description: Generates a simple list of safe/unsafe URLs.

resolver.description: Resolves vulnerable hostnames to IP addresses.
